intro: Hieracium macrelliforme, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium macrelliforme is often found in meadows and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
